Platform.Title: JCVI PFGRC Mycobacterium tuberculosis 22K v4 array designed primarily based on strain H37Rv
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: 4QMT, with arrayer GENETIX, machine cycles 0, pen id 0, pen cycles 0, operator 0, humidity control 0, humidity set point0.000
Platform.Description: This set includes 4742 oligonucleotides, has 22176 spots distributed in 48 blocks.

Column.Name: Primary Target
Column.Description: Locus primarily hit by the oligo

Sample.Title: Vector expressing Hcl1 peptide RNA (Cy3) 1

Channel.Source: Total RNA from Mtb containing Hcl1pVV16
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv competent cells were transfromed with either Hcl1pVV16 (Experimental) or pVV16 (Control) plasmids. Three individual colonies from each transformant picked, grown till mid-log phase and total RNA isolated.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Mycobacteria harboring either hcl1pVV16 (EXP) or pVV16 (CTL) were grown till mid-log phase in Middlebrook 7H9 broth supplemented with 10% ADC (Difco) at 37ºC and 200 rpm.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was extracted using hot phenol method and purified using Rneasy mini kit (Qiagen) followed by on-column DNaseI digestion as instructed by the manufacturer.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Equal amount of RNA from each sample (Experimental as well as control- both in triplicates) were labeled with Cy3 and Cy5 dyes using CyScribe First strand cDNA labeling kit (Amersham/GE Healthcare) following manufacturer's protocol.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The hybridization protocol used was as described by TIGR SOP#8 (http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html)
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides scanned using ScanArray Gx Scanner (PerkinElmer) and image analysis done using ScanArray Express (PerkinElmer)
Sample.Data-Processing: Images were quantified using ScanArray Express (PerkinElmer), using LOWESS algorithm. Mean-background intensity values were transferred to Excel spreadsheets for further analysis. Data was analyzed using Z Score transformation as described previously (Cheadle et al., 2003, published in J. Mol. Diagn.)

Series.Title: Effect of phenylalanine-rich peptide on growth and survival of Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv (Mtb)
Series.Summary: During our efforts to isolate potantial binding partners of Esat6, we isolated few peptides rich in phenylalanine residues that strongly interacted with Esat6. All peptides were less than fifty amino acids in length, One of them, Hcl1, when expressed in mycobacteria showed significant retardation in growth and survival within macrophages. Microarray analysis showed that Hcl1 affects a host of genes and cellular pathways.
Series.Overall-Design: RNA was isolated from exponentially growing mycobacteria containing either plasmid vector pVV16 encoding peptide or vector pVV16 alone. Comparisons were made between Experimental (Mtb/Hcl1) and control (Mtb/pVV16) samples by extracting raw intensity values from multiple arrays.
